de.erichseifert.gral.plots

Class PiePlot

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.erichseifert.gral.graphics.AbstractDrawable
      • de.erichseifert.gral.graphics.DrawableContainer
        • de.erichseifert.gral.plots.StylableContainer
          • de.erichseifert.gral.plots.AbstractPlot
            • de.erichseifert.gral.plots.PiePlot
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataListener, Container, Drawable, Navigable, Plot, SettingsListener, SettingsStorage, Serializable, Iterable<Drawable>

    public class PiePlot
extends AbstractPlot
implements Navigable

    Class that displays data as segments of a pie plot. Empty segments are displayed for negative values.

    To create a new PiePlot simply create a new instance using a data source. Example:

     DataTable data = new DataTable(Integer.class, Double.class);
 data.add(-23.50);
 data.add(100.00);
 data.add( 60.25);

 PiePlot plot = new PiePlot(data);
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Class that represents the drawing area of a PiePlot.
      static class  PiePlot.PiePlotLegend
      A legend implementation for pie plots that displays items for each data value of a data source.
      static class  PiePlot.PiePlotNavigator
      Navigator implementation for pie plots.
      static class  PiePlot.PieSliceRenderer
      A point renderer for a single slice in a pie plot.
      protected static class  PiePlot.Slice
      Data class for storing slice information in world units.

    • Field Detail

      • AXIS_TANGENTIAL

        public static final String AXIS_TANGENTIAL
        Key for specifying the tangential axis of a pie plot.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CENTER

        public static final Key CENTER
        Key for specifying Point2D instance defining the center of the pie. The coordinates must be relative to the plot area dimensions, i.e. 0.0 means left/top, 0.5 means the center, and 1.0 means right/bottom.

      • RADIUS

        public static final Key RADIUS
        Key for specifying a Number value for the radius of the pie relative to the plot area size.

      • START

        public static final Key START
        Key for specifying a Number value for the starting angle of the first segment in degrees. The angle is applied counterclockwise.

      • CLOCKWISE

        public static final Key CLOCKWISE
        Key for specifying a Boolean value which decides whether the segments should be ordered clockwise (true) or counterclockwise (false).

      • getSlice

        protected PiePlot.Slice getSlice(DataSource source,
                     int index)
        Returns the sum of all absolute values from the specified data source up to the row with the specified index. This is used to determine the position of pie slices.
        Parameters:
        source - Data source.
        index - Index of the row.
